event.descr: A %service% outage was created on interface %interface% because of the following condition: %parm[eventReason]%.
event.logmsg: %service% outage identified on interface %interface%.

event.descr: The %service% service outage on interface %interface% has been restored.
event.logmsg: The %service% outage on interface %interface% has been resolved.

event.descr:
A forced rescan has identified the %service% service on interface %interface% as no longer part of any poller package, or the service has been unmanaged.

Polling will be discontinued.
event.logmsg: Polling will be discontinued for %service% service on interface %interface%.

event.descr:
A forced rescan has identified the %service% service on interface %interface% as covered by a poller package, and managed.

Polling will begin in accordance with the package and any applicable outage calendar.
event.logmsg: Polling will begin/resume for %service% service on interface %interface%.

event.descr: The service %service% on interface %interface% is being forcibly unmanaged.
event.logmsg: The service %service% on interface %interface% is being forcibly unmanaged.

event.descr: %service% data collection on interface %interface% failed because of the following condition: '%parm[reason]%'.
event.logmsg: %service% data collection on interface %interface% failed.

event.descr: %service% data collection on interface %interface% previously failed and has been restored.
event.logmsg: %service% data collection on interface %interface% previously failed and has been restored.

event.descr:
Due to excessive downtime, the %service% service on interface %interface% has been scheduled for deletion.

When a service has been down for one week, it is determined to have been removed and will be deleted. If the service is later rediscovered, it will be re-added and associated with the appropriate interface.

If this is the only service associated with an interface, the interface will be scheduled for deletion as well, with the generation of the deleteInterface event.
event.logmsg: The %service% service on interface %interface% has been scheduled for deletion.

event.descr: Node :%nodeid% labled: %nodelabel%; was determined to be a duplicate node and is has been deleted.
event.logmsg: Node #%nodeid% was determined to be a duplicate node and is being flagged for deletion.

event.descr:
Interface %interface% deleted from node # %nodeid% with ifIndex %ifindex%.

This event is generated following an extended outage for a service, in which that service is the only service associated with an interface. If the service is later rediscovered, a new interface will be added and the service will be associated with that new interface.
event.logmsg: Interface %interface% deleted from node #%nodeid% with ifIndex %ifindex%.

event.descr:
All services are down on interface %interface%

This event is generated when node outage processing determines that the critical service or all services on the interface are now down

New outage records have been created and service level availability calculations will be impacted until this outage is resolved.
event.logmsg: Interface %interface% is down.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined node event: snmp interface Oper Status Down
event.descr:
The operational status of interface is down

This event is generated when an snmp poll on interface find the operational status down.

Params %parm[all]%
event.logmsg: Operational status Down on interface ifname:%parm[snmpifname]% ifindex:%parm[snmpifindex]% ifdescr:%parm[snmpifdescr]%

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined node event: snmp interface Admin Status Down
event.descr:
The administration status of interface is down

This event is generated when an snmp poll on interface find the administration status down.

Params %parm[all]%
event.logmsg: Administration status Down on interface ifname:%parm[snmpifname]% ifindex:%parm[snmpifindex]% ifdescr:%parm[snmpifdescr]%

event.descr:
Interface %interface% has been reparented under node %parm[newNodeID]% from node %parm[oldNodeID]%.

Usually this happens after a services scan discovers that a node with multiple interfaces is now running an SNMP agent and is therefore able to reparent the node's interfaces under a single node identifier.

This is typically not a reason for concern, but you should be aware that the node association of this interface has changed.
event.logmsg: %interface% has been reparented under node %parm[newNodeID]% from node %parm[oldNodeID]%.

event.descr:
The interface %interface% which was previously down is now up.

This event is generated when node outage processing determines that the critical service or all services on the interface are restored.

This event will cause any active outages associated with this interface to be cleared.
event.logmsg: Interface %interface% is up.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined node event: snmp interface Oper Status Up
event.descr:
The operational status of interface is up

This event is generated when an snmp poll on interface find the operational status up.

Params %parm[all]%
event.logmsg: Operational status Up on interface ifname:%parm[snmpifname]% ifindex:%parm[snmpifindex]% ifdescr:%parm[snmpifdescr]%

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined node event: snmp interface Admin Status Up
event.descr:
The administration status of interface is down

This event is generated when an snmp poll on interface find the administration status up.

Params %parm[all]%
event.logmsg: Administration status Up on interface ifname:%parm[snmpifname]% ifindex:%parm[snmpifindex]% ifdescr:%parm[snmpifdescr]%

event.descr: A new node (%parm[nodelabel]%) was discovered by OpenNMS.
event.logmsg: A new node (%parm[nodelabel]%) was discovered by OpenNMS.

event.descr: A currently provisioned node (%parm[nodelabel]%) was updated by OpenNMS.
event.logmsg: A provisioned node (%parm[nodelabel]%) was updated by OpenNMS.

event.descr: Node category membership has changed for node (%parm[nodelabel]%)
event.logmsg: Node category membership has changed for node (%parm[nodelabel]%).

event.descr:
Node %nodeid% was deleted.

OpenNMS will delete any node that is down for seven (7) consecutive days, or via operator action. Nodes are considered "down" if there are no interfaces that have pollable services associated with them.

If a node becomes active again after it has been deleted, it will be rediscovered in the next, daily discovery cycle and will be re-added to OpenNMS's database as a new node. It will be disassociated with any historic outage information.
event.logmsg: Node %nodeid% was deleted.

event.descr:
All interfaces on node %parm[nodelabel]% are down because of the following condition: %parm[eventReason]%.

This event is generated when node outage processing determines that all interfaces on the node are down.

New outage records have been created and service level availability calculations will be impacted until this outage is resolved.
event.logmsg: Node %parm[nodelabel]% is down.

event.descr:
The state of node %parm[nodelabel]% is unknown because the critical path to the node is down.

This event is generated when node outage processing determines that the critical path IP address/service for this node is not responding..
event.logmsg: %parm[nodelabel]% path outage. Critical path = %parm[criticalPathIp]% %parm[criticalPathServiceName]%

event.descr: Interface %interface% has been associated with Node #%nodeid%.
event.logmsg: Interface %interface% has been associated with Node #%nodeid%.

event.descr:
A service scan has identified the %service% service on interface %interface%.

If this interface (%interface%) is within the list of ranges and specific addresses to be managed by OpenNMS, this service will be scheduled for regular availability checks.
event.logmsg: The %service% service has been discovered on interface %interface%.

event.descr: Node information has changed for node #%nodeid%.
event.logmsg: Node information has changed for %nodeid%.

event.descr: Node #%nodeid%'s label was changed from "%parm[oldNodeLabel]%" to "%parm[newNodeLabel]%".
event.logmsg: Node #%nodeid%'s label was changed from "%parm[oldNodeLabel]%" to "%parm[newNodeLabel]%".

event.descr:
A %service% outage was identified on interface %interface% because of the following condition: %parm[eventReason]%.

A new Outage record has been created and service level availability calculations will be impacted until this outage is resolved.
event.logmsg: %service% outage identified on interface %interface%.

event.descr:
The %service% service on interface %interface% was previously down and has been restored.

This event is generated when a service which had previously failed polling attempts is again responding to polls by OpenNMS.

This event will cause any active outages associated with this service/interface combination to be cleared.
event.logmsg: The %service% outage on interface %interface% has been cleared. Service is restored.

event.descr:
Node %parm[nodelabel]% which was previously down is now up.

This event is generated when node outage processing determines that all interfaces on the node are up.

This event will cause any active outages associated with this node to be cleared.
event.logmsg: Node %parm[nodelabel]% is up.

event.descr: This event indicates that the interface selected for SNMP data collection for this node has changed. This is usually due to a network or address reconfiguration impacting this device.
event.logmsg: Primary SNMP interface for node %nodeid% has changed from %parm[oldPrimarySnmpAddress]% to %parm[newPrimarySnmpAddress]%.

event.descr: A change in configuration on this node has been detected and the SNMP data collection mechanism is being triggered to refresh its required profile of the remote node.
event.logmsg: SNMP information on %interface% is being refreshed for data collection purposes.

event.descr: The %service% service which was previously unresponsive is now responding normally on interface %interface%.
event.logmsg: %service% is responding normally on interface %interface%.

event.descr:
Service %service% was deleted from interface %interface%, associated with Node ID# %nodeid%.

When a service is deleted from an interface, it is due to extended downtime of that service of over seven (7) days.

If a previously deleted service becomes active again on an interface, it will be re-added to the OpenNMS database as a new occurrence of that service and will be disassociated with any historic outages.
event.logmsg: The %service% service was deleted from interface %interface%.

event.descr: The %service% service is up but was unresponsive during the last poll on interface %interface%.
event.logmsg: %service% is up but unresponsive on interface %interface%.

event.descr: The Asset info for node %nodeid% (%nodelabel%) has been changed via the webUI.
event.logmsg: The Asset info for node %nodeid% (%nodelabel%) has been changed via the webUI.
